channel.title: Need help changing highest combat lvl
channel.description:
kk basicly my lvls are default runescape lvls (max lvl on a skill is 99 and max combat lvl is 126)
how do i make the max lvl on a skill like.. 150?

item.title: Need help changing highest combat lvl
item.dc:creator: @cmckiller cmckiller
item.description:
@cmckiller wrote:

oh…sorry i missread and it would work with the max skill level at 150 i should think

i misread the topic and posted to give more help towards 150 cbt…

lol

add my msn so we can discuss:
chrisncal_@hotmail.co.uk

Read full topic

item.title: Need help changing highest combat lvl
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

mrpopyman:

How do i make the max lvl on a skill like… 150?

so he also wanted to know how to put his skill lvl limit to 150…so…wouldn’t it work that way?

Read full topic
item.source: Need help changing highest combat lvl

item.title: Need help changing highest combat lvl
item.dc:creator: @cmckiller cmckiller
item.description:
@cmckiller wrote:

Fear… i think the:
for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 150; lvl++) {
is what all the skill levels will be if you do this.

where as its:
for (int lvl = 1; lvl <=99; lvl++) {

the 99 indicates a skill level, and unless he wants all his skill levels at 150 then this will not work.

(it will work but it won’t be the desired combat level he wants)

Read full topic
item.source: Need help changing highest combat lvl

item.title: Need help changing highest combat lvl
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

[quote=“mrpopyman, post:1, topic:350001”]kk basicly my lvls are default runescape lvls (max lvl on a skill is 99 and max combat lvl is 126)

how do i make the max lvl on a skill like… 150?[/quote]

I found this in my client.java

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 13034430) return 99; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; }

try changing it to this:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (exp > 99999999) return 150; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 150; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; }

I don’t really know which xp this: 99999999 should be…

but as soon as your lvl 150 you could see how much xp it takes?

tell me if it worked

Read full topic
